body:
1. If you see a troll downvote them, move on, and DON'T FEED THEM under any circumstances. 
2. If you see someone you disagree with you're free to fight their ideas with yours or simply ignore them. 

I'm not really seeing a level of trolling/extremism that's concerning yet, but following those two rules should help mitigate the problem.

body: This is what happens in a free speech environment. But I'd rather have this than an environment where you have to constantly fear being banned and/or silenced for sharing a different opinion as it is on other platforms. If you see a troll, downvote and block them and move on. That said, I still wouldn't want to be on a site dominated by awful trolls either. Since this is a free speech site, we can only hope for the best.

body:
Here is the danger.  The left or the right can move in and overwhelm an entire community if they outnumber them.   This is especially true for non-mainstream beliefs.  On Reddit, the left activists outnumber everyone, and they have the power to totally take over and control any sub they want.     What we see on reddit is that all it really takes is a relatively small number of dedicated activist types from the far-left or far-right to destroy a sub/community and make it inhospitable and shut down any conversations by those genuinely interested in the community topic.   That is one the of the things that is driving people here in the first place.

How can that be kept from happening here?
